# Extendicare## PROCEDURE**MANUAL:** Infection Prevention and Control
**INDEX:** IPC7-P10.02
**SECTION:** Immunization of Staff
**EFFECTIVE DATE:** February 18, 2025
**REVIEWED DATE:** February 11, 2025
**APPROVED BY:** Chief Medical Officer
**MODIFIED DATE:** May 30, 2025----## POLICY### Immunization of Residents and Staff## PROCEDURE1. Staff submit a completed Staff Immunization/TB Testing Record as a component of the hiring process for new employees that includes results for:
a. Current immunizations including seasonal influenza; and
b. TB record or screening tool to be reviewed for completion, as provincially required. c. Arrange for follow-up and appropriate testing with your physician/nurse practitioner if you are a new staff member who has had previous reaction to a TB test. You must submit a note indicating your negative TB status before you can begin working at the home. d. A copy of the Staff Immunization/TB testing record is to be kept in the staff member's health file and uploaded to Workday.### External Guidelines- **Manitoba** – TST testing is presently not required. Refer to Occupational Health and Safety. - **Alberta** - A single step TST is recommended.

Refer to Occupational Health and Safety. - **Alberta** - A single step TST is recommended. A two-step TST is required for those who work in high-risk areas where residents with active TB are present. - **Ontario** - A 2 step TST is recommended 1-4 weeks apart. If a single step has been done within the past year and is negative, a second step can be performed alone for those not at high risk of TB exposure.## TOOLS1. IPC7-P10-T1 - Staff Vaccination Medical Directive Form
